cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.current_location: about 415 miles SSW of Havana, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to accelerate northward tonight, then turn northeast on Saturday, crossing western Cuba late Saturday and moving through the north-western Bahamas early Sunday while passing just south-east of South Florida
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Cuba near Isla de la Juventud / Havana

weather_observation.watch_coast: None at this time; interests in South Florida and the Florida Keys are advised to monitor the system
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for Isla de la Juventud and western Cuba provinces, and for the north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Cuba, Straits of Florida, Florida Keys and South Florida, north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible (peak 34-kt probability 11%, sustained winds most likely under 39 mph)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along Biscayne Bay and the Miami waterfront, but significant (>3 ft) surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches likely with isolated amounts near 8 inches, producing urban flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Frequent squalls reducing visibility, lightning, and short-period harbor swell that could disrupt cargo handling and pilot transfers
